dependencies.description:
Differentiate, compile, and transform Numpy code. JAX is a Python
library for accelerator-oriented array computation and program
transformation, designed for high-performance numerical computing and
large-scale machine learning.
dependencies.name: py-jax

dependencies.description:
Type annotations and runtime checking for shape and dtype of JAX arrays,
and PyTrees.
dependencies.name: py-jaxtyping

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).
dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

description:
Equinox is a comprehensive JAX library that provides a wide range of
tools and features not found in core JAX, including neural networks with
PyTorch-like syntax, filtered APIs for transformations, PyTree
manipulation routines, and advanced features like runtime errors.
name: py-equinox

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
